content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/search_strands_20260128/spring-boot-helloWorld is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
The user wants me to migrate a Java 8 codebase to Java 17. I should:

1. First, explore the repository structure to understand what we're working with
2. Check the pom.xml file to see current Java version and dependencies
3. Update the Java version to 17
4. Update any dependencies that need to be updated for Java 17 compatibility
5. Check for any code that might need changes for Java 17
6. Run `mvn clean verify` to ensure everything works

Let me start by exploring the repository structure.

File content displayed in console.
Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

	<groupId>com.neo</groupId>
	<artifactId>spring-boot-helloworld</artifactId>
	<version>0.9.6-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<packaging>jar</packaging>

	<name>spring-boot-helloworld</name>
	<description>Demo project for Spring Boot</description>

	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.1.3.RELEASE</version>
		<relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<java.version>1.8</java.version>
	</properties>

	<dependencies>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
	     <dependency>
	        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
	        <artifactId>spring-boot-devtools</artifactId>
	        <optional>true</optional>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>
	
	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
				<configuration>
	                <fork>true</fork>
	            </configuration>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>

        <repositories>
            <repository>
                <id>aliyun-repos</id>
                <url>https://maven.aliyun.com/repository/public</url>
                <releases>
                    <enabled>true</enabled>
                </releases>
                <snapshots>
                    <enabled>false</enabled>
                </snapshots>
            </repository>
        </repositories>
        <pluginRepositories>
            <pluginRepository>
                <id>aliyun-repos</id>
                <url>https://maven.aliyun.com/repository/public</url>
                <releases>
                    <enabled>true</enabled>
                </releases>
                <snapshots>
                    <enabled>false</enabled>
                </snapshots>
            </pluginRepository>
        </pluginRepositories>

</project>
Now let me check the Java source files to see if there are any Java 8 specific features that need updating:
Let me check the test files as well:
Now let me look up the recommended Spring Boot version for Java 17:
Recommended version for 'org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-parent': 3.3.4

Perfect! Now I'll start the migration process. Here's what needs to be done:

1. **Update pom.xml**: Change Java version from 1.8 to 17 and upgrade Spring Boot from 2.1.3 to 3.3.4
2. **Update test files**: Spring Boot 3.x requires JUnit 5 (Jupiter) instead of JUnit 4, so I'll need to update the test annotations

Let me start by updating the pom.xml:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/search_strands_20260128/spring-boot-helloWorld/pom.xml
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string: 	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.1.3.RELEASE</version>
		<relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<java.version>1.8</java.version>
	</properties>
New string: 	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>3.3.4</version>
		<relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<java.version>17</java.version>
	</properties>

Excellent! The build succeeded with all tests passing! However, I noticed a warning about the `fork` parameter in the spring-boot-maven-plugin. Let's clean that up by removing that deprecated parameter:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/search_strands_20260128/spring-boot-helloWorld/pom.xml
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string: 	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
				<configuration>
	                <fork>true</fork>
	            </configuration>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>
New string: 	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>
Now let's run `mvn clean verify` one more time to confirm the warning is gone:

Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

	<groupId>com.neo</groupId>
	<artifactId>spring-boot-helloworld</artifactId>
	<version>0.9.6-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<packaging>jar</packaging>

	<name>spring-boot-helloworld</name>
	<description>Demo project for Spring Boot</description>

	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>3.3.4</version>
		<relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<java.version>17</java.version>
	</properties>

	<dependencies>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
	     <dependency>
	        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
	        <artifactId>spring-boot-devtools</artifactId>
	        <optional>true</optional>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>
	
	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>

input.file_text:
# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Overview
Successfully migrated the Spring Boot Hello World application from Java 8 to Java 17.

## Changes Made

### 1. pom.xml
- **Java Version**: Updated from `1.8` to `17`
- **Spring Boot Version**: Upgraded from `2.1.3.RELEASE` to `3.3.4`
- **Maven Plugin**: Removed deprecated `fork` configuration parameter from spring-boot-maven-plugin

### 2. Test Files Migration (JUnit 4 to JUnit 5)

#### ApplicationTests.java
- Replaced `org.junit.Test` with `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`
- Removed `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` annotation (no longer needed in Spring Boot 3.x)
- Removed unused imports

#### HelloTests.java
- Replaced `org.junit.Before` with `org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach`
- Replaced `org.junit.Test` with `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`
- Removed `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` annotation
- Removed unused imports (MockServletContext, SpringJUnit4ClassRunner, SpringRunner, WebAppConfiguration)

#### HelloWorldControlerTests.java
- Replaced `org.junit.Before` with `org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach`
- Replaced `org.junit.Test` with `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`
- Removed `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)` annotation
- Removed unused imports (MockServletContext, SpringJUnit4ClassRunner, SpringRunner, WebAppConfiguration)

### 3. Source Code
No changes were required to the main application code:
- `com.neo.Application.java` - No changes needed
- `com.neo.controller.HelloWorldController.java` - No changes needed

## Verification

### Build Success
```bash
mvn clean verify
```
- ✅ All tests pass (3 tests run, 0 failures, 0 errors, 0 skipped)
- ✅ Build completes successfully
- ✅ No warnings or errors

### Runtime Verification
```bash
mvn spring-boot:run
```
- ✅ Application starts successfully on port 8080
- ✅ All endpoints responding correctly:
  - `GET /` returns "Hello Spring Boot 2.0!"
  - `GET /hello` returns "Hello World from MageEdu.com!"
  - `GET /version` returns "version 0.9.6!"

## Key Migration Points

### Spring Boot 3.x Changes
- **JUnit 5 (Jupiter)**: Spring Boot 3.x uses JUnit 5 by default, requiring test annotation updates
- **Jakarta EE**: Spring Boot 3.x uses Jakarta EE instead of javax.* (though this didn't affect our simple application)
- **Baseline Requirements**: Java 17 is the minimum required version for Spring Boot 3.x

### Java 17 Features
While this application doesn't use advanced Java features, Java 17 provides:
- Enhanced performance and security
- New language features (sealed classes, pattern matching, text blocks, records, etc.)
- Long-term support (LTS) version

## Compatibility
- **JDK Version**: Java 17.0.17
- **Spring Boot Version**: 3.3.4
- **Maven Compiler**: Release target set to 17
- **JUnit**: Version 5 (Jupiter)

## Conclusion
The migration was successful with minimal changes required. The application builds, tests, and runs correctly on Java 17 with Spring Boot 3.3.4.

## ✅ Migration Complete: Java 8 → Java 17

I have successfully migrated the Spring Boot Hello World application from Java 8 to Java 17. Here's what was accomplished:

### **Key Changes:**

1. **pom.xml Updates:**
   - ✅ Java version: `1.8` → `17`
   - ✅ Spring Boot: `2.1.3.RELEASE` → `3.3.4` (Java 17 compatible, LTS version)
   - ✅ Removed deprecated `fork` parameter from spring-boot-maven-plugin

2. **Test Framework Migration (JUnit 4 → JUnit 5):**
   - ✅ Updated `ApplicationTests.java`
   - ✅ Updated `HelloTests.java`
   - ✅ Updated `HelloWorldControlerTests.java`
   - Key changes: `@Test` imports, `@Before` → `@BeforeEach`, removed `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)`

3. **Source Code:**
   - ✅ No changes required - code is compatible with Java 17

### **Verification Results:**

✅ **Build Status:** SUCCESS  
✅ **All Tests Pass:** 3/3 tests passing  
✅ **Runtime Test:** Application starts and all endpoints working correctly  
✅ **No Warnings or Errors**

### **Test Results:**
```
Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
- com.neo.controller.HelloTests ✓
- com.neo.controller.HelloWorldControlerTests ✓
- com.neo.ApplicationTests ✓
```

### **Verified Endpoints:**
- `GET /` → "Hello Spring Boot 2.0!" ✓
- `GET /hello` → "Hello World from MageEdu.com!" ✓
- `GET /version` → "version 0.9.6!" ✓

The codebase is now fully migrated to Java 17 and ready for production use! A detailed migration summary has been saved to `MIGRATION_SUMMARY.md` in the project root.
